o:ExtendedAttributeTargetItem.a:Name: mdde_ParentAttributeSelector
o:ExtendedAttributeTargetItem.a:GetMethodScript:
Function %Get%(obj) 'Initialize the return value to an empty string. %Get% = ""
' Get the parent source object and attribute. Dim objParentSourceObject : Set objParentSourceObject = obj.GetExtendedAttribute("mdde_ParentSourceObject") Dim objParentAttribute : Set objParentAttribute = obj.GetExtendedAttribute("mdde_ParentAttribute") Dim strParentLiteralValue : strParentLiteralValue = obj.GetExtendedAttribute("mdde_ParentLiteralValue")
' If a literal value is specified, use that. If Len(strParentLiteralValue) > 0 Then %Get% = strParentLiteralValue ' If the child attribute is not empty, return the FQ name. ElseIf Not(objParentSourceObject Is Nothing) And Not(objParentAttribute Is Nothing) Then %Get% = objParentSourceObject.DisplayName & "." & objParentAttribute.DisplayName End If
End Function
o:ExtendedAttributeTargetItem.a:SetMethodScript:
Sub %Set%(obj, value) ' The Set method is used when someone types a value in the 'Parent attribute (MDDE)' field. ' This is used to set literal values, like numeric and textual values. ' For setting an attribute, the ... should be used (which call the edit method).
' If the input value is numeric or encapsulated with quotes, we store the value in the mdde_ParentLiteralValue extended attribute. If IsLiteralValue(value) Then obj.SetExtendedAttribute "mdde_ParentLiteralValue", value ' Empty the source object and attribute references, since we the value is a literal now. obj.SetExtendedAttribute "mdde_ParentSourceObject", Nothing obj.SetExtendedAttribute "mdde_ParentAttribute", Nothing
' Otherwise we show a message. Else MsgBox "The entered value is not a valid literal value!" & vbCrLf & vbCrLf _ & "It should either be numeric or encapsulated with single quotes (')." & vbCrLf & vbCrLf _ & "For non-literal values, use the [...] button to select an attribute." _ , vbExclamation _ , "Unexpected value" End If End Sub
o:ExtendedAttributeTargetItem.a:Label: Parent attribute (MDDE)
